frontmatter.title: Who wants to be a Millionaire esque app made with Next.js and tailwind
frontmatter.comments: I used next.js and tailwind for this app to learn more about them. Later, i'd like to improve the helper buttons and implement 'ask the audience' etc.
frontmatter.description: I made this for a friend of mine as he really enjoys quizing. There is an internal database of questions, and I wanted to make it so more sets can be added by a non technical user. Then it can cycle through the different sets of questions to give the user a different ranges like the game show does.

frontmatter.title: An artist website to promote a body of work. Created using svelte
frontmatter.comments: I decided to use svelte as I have heard a lot about it, and thought it would be a great opportunity for me to learn something new. For the css I used grid and flexbox.
frontmatter.description: I made this for someone that I work with as he has a real passion for art, and discussed the desire to make a website to display it. I'd later like to improve the login page for the site owner.

frontmatter.title: YouTube clone with data from an API, using Gatsby
frontmatter.comments: I made this app with Gatsby and an internal DB taken from RapidAPI. I also used styled components with css grid. Later I'd like to optimise the page, implement a proper API db and find a better source for the data.
frontmatter.description: I found this to be a great exercise and really easy to do. I wanted to do everything from scratch to prove I could pull off a copy cat website, which I think I succeeded at.

frontmatter.title: Weather app that calls data from an API made with React, Typescript and SASS
frontmatter.comments: This is a simple weather app I made for someone. I used typescript with React to learn more about how they work with each other. I also used SASS as I really enjoy the readability and cleanliness of it
frontmatter.description: Further along, i'd like to make this site more complex in terms of what data is shown, as there is much more from the API. I struggled intially to keep the personal API key hidden but vercel helps greatly with this

frontmatter.title: Games website with whack-a-mole made with Gatsby and styled components
frontmatter.comments: I made this app with Gatsby and styled components with css grid. This was the first game I created and I'd really like to make more.
frontmatter.description: This project is a little bit old now but I wanted to include it here as it I was impressed with how simple it was to make at the time.
